page.title: 06An event in Pontypridd
page.content: Something exciting happened at the Old Bridge a few weeks ago. There was a huge bang,followed by another and another.A lorry which was going across the Victoria Bridge had exploded with about 20 gas cylinders on it.They all blew up and flew through the air and over the bridge. They didn't do much damage,which is a good thing because the bridge is the symbol of our town. There are souvenirs of the bridge for sale in lots of shops and it even used to be painted on the sides of our buses until Pontypridd Council became part of Taff-Ely.There are even little bridges on top of the rugby posts at Sardis Rd.ground.The town takes its name from the bridge.When it was built in 1756 it was called Newbridge but it was changed to Pont-y-ty-pridd which means "Bridge by the earthen house." By a pupil of Coed-y-lan CP school.
